trans-unit.source: Specifies information about how a document is printed, including the printer that prints it, when printing from a Windows Forms application.

Typically, you access a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings> through <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrinterSettings%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings.PrinterSettings%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties to modify printer settings.
The most common printer setting is <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterName%2A>, which specifies the printer to print to.
For more information about printing with Windows Forms, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview.
If you wish to print from a Windows Presentation Foundation application, see the <xref:System.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings"></xref> class.
The default constructor initializes all fields to their default values.

Typically, you do not create an instance of <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings>, but instead use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrinterSettings%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to set settings for the printer.
Gets a value indicating whether the printer supports double-sided printing.
To print using duplex, and if the printer supports it, set <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.Duplex%2A> to one of the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.Duplex> values.
`true` if the printer supports double-sided printing; otherwise, `false`.
Creates a copy of this <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings"></xref>.
A copy of this object.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the printed document is collated.
Collating is performed only when the number of copies is greater than 1.
Set the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.Copies%2A> property to specify the number of copies to print.
Setting <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.Collate%2A> to `true` will print a complete copy of the document before the first page of the next copy is printed.
`false` will print each page by the number of copies specified before printing the next page.
`true` if the printed document is collated; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the number of copies of the document to print.
Not all printers support printing multiple copes.
You can use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MaximumCopies%2A> property to determine the maximum number of copies the printer supports.
If the number of copies is set higher than the maximum copies supported by the printer, only the maximum number of copies will be printed, and no exception will occur.
Some printers might not support printing more than one copy at a time.
The number of copies to print.
The default is 1.
The value of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.Copies"></xref> property is less than zero.
Returns a <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> that contains printer information associated with the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref>.
With the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.CreateMeasurementGraphics%2A> method, you can obtain a <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> for the printer without creating a print job.
Use the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> to make decisions on how to layout visual elements like fonts, sizes, and type styles of a complex print job.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref> to retrieve a graphics object for.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> that contains printer information from the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref>.
Creates a <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> associated with the specified page settings and optionally specifying the origin at the margins.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.CreateMeasurementGraphics%2A> method allows you to obtain a <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> for the printer without creating a print job.
Use the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> to make decisions on how to layout visual elements like fonts, sizes, and type styles of a complex print job.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref> to retrieve a <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> object for.
`true` to specify the origin at the margins; otherwise, `false`.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> that contains printer information from the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref>.
Returns a <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> that contains printer information that is useful when creating a <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument"></xref>.
With the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.CreateMeasurementGraphics%2A> method, you can obtain a <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> for the printer without creating a print job.
You can use the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> to make decisions on how to layout visual elements like fonts, sizes, and type styles of a complex print job.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> that contains information from a printer.
The printer named in the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterName"></xref> property does not exist.
Returns a <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> that contains printer information, optionally specifying the origin at the margins.
With the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.CreateMeasurementGraphics%2A> method, you can obtain a <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> for the printer without creating a print job.
Use the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> to make decisions on how to layout visual elements like fonts, sizes, and type styles of a complex print job.
`true` to indicate the origin at the margins; otherwise, `false`.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> that contains printer information from the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref>.
Gets the default page settings for this printer.
Page settings include the size of the margins on the page, the size of paper to use, and whether to print in color.
For more information about page settings, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings> class.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref> that represents the default page settings for this printer.
Gets or sets the printer setting for double-sided printing.
You can use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.CanDuplex%2A> property to check to see if the printer supports duplex printing.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Duplex"></xref> values.
The default is determined by the printer.
The value of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.Duplex"></xref> property is not one of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.Duplex"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the page number of the first page to print.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> properties are used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> when the user selects a print range.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog.AllowSomePages%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property must be set to `true` to enable the user to specify a print range.

In addition, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> requires the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MinimumPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MaximumPage%2A> to be specified and the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A> value to be within that range.

During the printing process, in the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage?displayProperty=fullName> event, view the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> to determine what should be printed.

If <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> is <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintRange?displayProperty=fullName>, use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> properties to determine what pages should be printed.
If <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> is <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintRange?displayProperty=fullName>, then specify output only for the selected pages.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> can also be set programmatically, though the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage?displayProperty=fullName> implementation is the same.
The page number of the first page to print.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage"></xref> property's value is less than zero.
Creates a handle to a `DEVMODE` structure that corresponds to the printer settings.
`DEVMODE` structures are device specific.
Copying a `DEVMODE` structure from one <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings> to a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings> for a different printer is not supported.
When you are done with the handle that is created through this method, you must deallocate it yourself by calling the native Win32 `GlobalFree` method.
When you call this method, you pass as a parameter the return value from the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.GetHdevmode%2A> method.
A handle to a `DEVMODE` structure.
The printer named in the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterName"></xref> property does not exist.
The printer's initialization information could not be retrieved.
Creates a handle to a `DEVMODE` structure that corresponds to the printer and the page settings specified through the pageSettings parameter.
`DEVMODE` structures are device specific.
Copying a `DEVMODE` structure from one <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings> to a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings> for a different printer is not supported.
When you are done with the handle that is created through this method, you must deallocate it yourself by calling the native Win32 `GlobalFree` method.
When you call this method, you pass as a parameter the return value from the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.GetHdevmode%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings"></xref> object that the `DEVMODE` structure's handle corresponds to.
A handle to a `DEVMODE` structure.
The printer named in the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterName"></xref> property does not exist.
The printer's initialization information could not be retrieved.
Creates a handle to a `DEVNAMES` structure that corresponds to the printer settings.
When you are done with the handle that is created through this method, you must deallocate it yourself by calling the native Win32 `GlobalFree` method.
When you call this method, you pass as a parameter the return value from the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.GetHdevnames%2A> method.
A handle to a `DEVNAMES` structure.
Gets the names of all printers installed on the computer.
You can use the collection of installed printer names to provide the user a choice of printers to print to.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.StringCollection"></xref> that represents the names of all printers installed on the computer.
The available printers could not be enumerated.

Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterName"></xref> property designates the default printer, except when the user explicitly sets <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterName"></xref>.

<xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.IsDefaultPrinter%2A> always returns `false` when you explicitly set the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterName%2A> property to a string value other than `null`.
`true` if <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterName"></xref> designates the default printer; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value indicating whether the printer supports printing the specified image format.
An <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat"></xref> to print.
`true` if the printer supports printing the specified image format; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the printer supports printing the specified image file.
The image to print.
`true` if the printer supports printing the specified image; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the printer is a plotter.
A plotter is a printer that is vector-based as opposed to raster-based.
Most vector-based printers use individual plotting pens to produce output.
`true` if the printer is a plotter; `false` if the printer is a raster.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterName"></xref> property designates a valid printer.
When you get or set some properties, a valid printer is required or else an exception is raised.

To avoid exceptions, use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.IsValid%2A> property after setting the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterName%2A> to safely determine if the printer is valid.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterName"></xref> property designates a valid printer; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the angle, in degrees, that the portrait orientation is rotated to produce the landscape orientation.
Valid rotation values are 90 and 270 degrees.
If landscape is not supported, the only valid rotation value is 0 degrees.
You set the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings.Landscape%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `true` to print a page in landscape format.
The angle, in degrees, that the portrait orientation is rotated to produce the landscape orientation.
Gets the maximum number of copies that the printer enables the user to print at a time.
Set the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.Copies%2A> property to the number of copies to print.
Use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MaximumCopies%2A> property to determine if your printer supports printing multiple copies at a time, because some printers do not.
The maximum number of copies that the printer enables the user to print at a time.

Gets or sets the maximum <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage"></xref> or <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage"></xref> that can be selected in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> properties are used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> when the user selects a print range.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog.AllowSomePages%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property must be set to `true` to enable the user to specify a print range.

When setting the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A> or <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> values programmatically, ensure that they are within the range defined by the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MinimumPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MaximumPage%2A> properties, or an exception is thrown when displaying the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog>.

The maximum <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage"></xref> or <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage"></xref> that can be selected in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog"></xref>.
The value of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MaximumPage"></xref> property is less than zero.

Gets or sets the minimum <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage"></xref> or <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage"></xref> that can be selected in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> properties are used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> when the user selects a print range.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog.AllowSomePages%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property must be set to `true` to enable the user to specify a print range.

When setting the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A> or <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> values programmatically, ensure that they are within the range defined by the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MinimumPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MaximumPage%2A> properties, or an exception is thrown when displaying the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog>.

The minimum <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage"></xref> or <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage"></xref> that can be selected in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog"></xref>.
The value of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MinimumPage"></xref> property is less than zero.
Gets the paper sizes that are supported by this printer.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PaperSizeCollection> contains <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize> instances that represent the paper sizes through the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.Kind%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which contains one of the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperKind> values.

Typically, you set a page's paper size through the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings.PaperSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to a valid <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize> available through the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PaperSizes%2A> collection.
To specify a custom paper size, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PaperSizeCollection"></xref> that represents the paper sizes that are supported by this printer.
Gets the paper source trays that are available on the printer.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PaperSourceCollection> contains <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSource> instances that represent the paper source trays through the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSource.Kind%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which contains one of the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSourceKind> values.

Typically, you set a page's paper source through the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings.PaperSource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to a valid <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSource> available through the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PaperSources%2A> collection.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PaperSourceCollection"></xref> that represents the paper source trays that are available on this printer.
Gets or sets the name of the printer to use.
After setting the printer name, call <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.IsValid%2A> to determine if the printer name is recognized as a valid printer on the system.
You can also use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.InstalledPrinters%2A> property to get a list of printers installed on the system.
The name of the printer to use.
Gets all the resolutions that are supported by this printer.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterResolutionCollection> contains <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterResolution> instances that represent the printer resolutions supported through the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterResolution.Kind%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property, which contains one of the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterResolutionKind> values.

Typically, you set a page's paper source through the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings.PrinterResolution%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to a valid <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterResolution> available through the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterResolutions%2A> collection.

If <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterResolutionKind> is `Custom`, then use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterResolution.X%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterResolution.Y%2A> properties to determine the custom printer resolution in the horizontal and vertical directions, respectively.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrinterResolutionCollection"></xref> that represents the resolutions that are supported by this printer.
Gets or sets the file name, when printing to a file.
The file name, when printing to a file.
Gets or sets the page numbers that the user has specified to be printed.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> property is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog>.when the user selects a print range.
The default <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> is `AllPages`.
To enable the user to specify a range of pages to print, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog.AllowSomePages%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property must be set to `true`.
To enable the user to specify the selected pages to print, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog.AllowSelection%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property must be set to `true`.

During the printing process, in the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage?displayProperty=fullName> event, view the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> to determine what should be printed.

If <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> is <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintRange?displayProperty=fullName>, use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> properties to determine what pages should be printed.
If <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> is <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintRange?displayProperty=fullName>, then specify output only for the selected pages.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> can also be set programmatically, though the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage?displayProperty=fullName> implementation is the same.
One of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintRange"></xref> values.
The value of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange"></xref> property is not one of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrintRange"></xref> values.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the printing output is sent to a file instead of a port.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintToFile%2A> property is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> when the user selects the **Print to file** option.

In such a case, the output port is set to "FILE," causing the Windows printing subsystem to prompt the user for a file name when the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.Print%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method is called.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintToFile%2A> property is only used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> and cannot be set programmatically.

The `Print to file` option only appears on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog.AllowPrintToFile%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to `true`.
`true` if the printing output is sent to a file; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Copies the relevant information out of the given handle and into the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings"></xref>.

`DEVMODE` structures are device specific and copying a `DEVMODE` structure from one <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings> to a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings> for a different printer is not supported.
The handle to a Win32 `DEVMODE` structure.
The printer handle is not valid.
Copies the relevant information out of the given handle and into the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings"></xref>.
The handle to a Win32 `DEVNAMES` structure.
The printer handle is invalid.
Gets a value indicating whether this printer supports color printing.
To print using color, and if the printer supports it, set <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings.Color%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to `true`.
`true` if this printer supports color; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the number of the last page to print.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> properties are used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> when the user selects a print range.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog.AllowSomePages%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property must be set to `true` to enable the user to specify a print range.

In addition, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PrintDialog> also requires the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MinimumPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.MaximumPage%2A> to be specified and the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> value to be within that range.

During the printing process, in the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage?displayProperty=fullName> event, view the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> to determine what should be printed.

If <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> is <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintRange?displayProperty=fullName>, use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> properties to determine what pages should be printed.
If <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> is <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintRange?displayProperty=fullName>, then specify output only for the selected pages.

The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.FromPage%2A>, <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PrintRange%2A> can also be set programmatically, though the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument.PrintPage?displayProperty=fullName> implementation is the same.
The number of the last page to print.
The value of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.ToPage"></xref> property is less than zero.
Provides information about the <xref href="System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings"></xref> in string form.
A string.
